definition: to injure
abbr. for Canada 加拿大[Jia1 na2 da4]/surname Jia

to add/plus/(used after an adverb such as 不, 大, 稍 etc, and before a disyllabic verb, to indicate that the action of the verb is applied to sth or sb previously mentioned)/to apply (restrictions etc) to (sb)/to give (support, consideration etc) to (sth)
to do harm to/to cause trouble to/harm/evil/calamity

sentences.english: A large share of the problem involves women victimizing women.
sentences.chinese: 此问题有很大部分是女性加害女性。

sentences.english: They pray for you today, and prey on you tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 他们今天为你祈祷，明天就会加害于你。

sentences.english: Investigate into the offenders relocation information in any other institute;
sentences.chinese: and二调查加害人在其他机构之处遇资料。

sentences.english: So why does it feel like even the lettuce is out to get us?
sentences.chinese: 那么为什么感觉甚至连莴苣都要加害我们呢？

sentences.english: To teach this, the perpetrator may experience dependency or powerlessness in some form.
sentences.chinese: 加害者会经历到某种形式的依赖或无能为力。

sentences.english: Do not accuse a man for no reason- when he has done you no harm.
sentences.chinese: 如果人没有加害于你，你不可无故与他相争。

sentences.english: My father Saul will not lay a hand on you.
sentences.chinese: 我父扫罗的手必不加害于你。

sentences.english: What I mean is, do you think she'd go behind your back try to hamstring you?
sentences.chinese: 我的意思是，你认为她会在你的背后加害于你吗？

sentences.english: Better garbage system couldn't harm us either.
sentences.chinese: 更好的垃圾回收系统也不会加害于我们。

sentences.english: Strive not with a man without cause, if he have done thee no harm.
sentences.chinese: 人未曾加害与你，不可无故与他相争。

sentences.english: I did the poor child no harm .
sentences.chinese: 我没有加害于这个可怜的小孩。

sentences.english: In the thin ring desire to harm someone rises, stand up suddenly stop zishu emphasize.
sentences.chinese: 在细响欲出手加害上升时，子书突然挺身而出阻止。

definition: to conspire to murder/to plot against sb's life
to kill secretly/to stab in the back
to entrap/to set up/to frame (up)/to make false charges against
to attack murderously/to strike treacherously
to murder
to frame/to bring false charges against
to assassinate/to commit a murder
to impute/to shift the blame onto someone else
to entrap/to frame/to plant false evidence against sb
willfully slaughter the innocent (idiom)
to feel hatred/to harbor a grudge
to frame sb (by planting sth on them)
to seize
to harbor hard feelings
to frame sb/to accuse falsely
to kill/to cause death/to do sb to death
